sen.j: 馬路石邊神社（うまじいそべじんじゃ）は滋賀県守山市に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Umaji Isobe-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine that exists in Moriyama City, Shiga prefecture.
Umaji Isobe-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Moriyama City, Shiga prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existsをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Umaji Isobe-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Moriyama City, Shiga prefecture.
It is a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).
It is a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).
It is a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).

sen.j: 白鳳3年に創祀され、朱鳥元年に大己貴命を合祀したと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that in 674 the shrine was built, and in 686 Onamuchi no mikoto was enshrined together.
It is said that in 674 the shrine was built, and in 686 Onamuchi no mikoto was enshrined together.
It is said that in 674 the shrine was built, and in 686 Onamuchi no mikoto was enshrined together.

sen.j: 往古、馬道郷を拠点とする豪族であった石邊君が氏神として奉斎した神社である。
sen.e: It is the shrine dedicated by Isobe no kimi, a Gozoku (local ruling family) based in Umamichi no sato as the ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) in ancient times.

It is the shrine dedicated by Isobe no kimi, a Gozoku (local ruling family) based in Umamichi no sato as the ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) in ancient times.

It is the shrine dedicated by Isobe no kimi, a Gozoku (local ruling family) based in Umamichi no sato as the ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion) in ancient times.

sen.j: 中世には田中荘の鎮守社として「田中大明神」「田中天王社」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: In the medieval period it was also called as Tanaka Daimyojin (the Great God of Tanaka) and Tanaka Tenno-sha Shrine as the chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Tanaka no sho.

In the medieval period it was also called as Tanaka Daimyojin (the Great God of Tanaka) and Tanaka Tenno-sha Shrine as the chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Tanaka no sho.

In the medieval period it was also called as Tanaka Daimyojin (the Great God of Tanaka) and Tanaka Tenno-sha Shrine as the chinju-sha shrine (Shinto shrine on Buddhist temple grounds dedicated to the tutelary deity of the area) of Tanaka no sho.

sen.j: 戦国期には六角氏の崇敬を受けたが、元亀・天正の争乱によりすべてを失った。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period (period of warring states) it was venerated by Rokkaku clan, but all of the shrine buildings were lost in the incident of Genki and Tensho.
In the Sengoku period (period of warring states) it was venerated by the Rokkaku clan, but all of the shrine buildings were lost in the incident of Genki and Tensho.
sen.cmt: the Rokkaku clan としました。
sen.e: In the Sengoku period (period of warring states) it was venerated by the Rokkaku clan, but all of the shrine buildings were lost in the incident of Genki and Tensho.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入り再建され、現在の社殿は文久2年のものである。
sen.e: In the Edo period it was rebuilt, and the current shrine building was built in 1862.
In the Edo period it was rebuilt, and the current shrine building was built in 1862.
In the Edo period it was rebuilt, and the current shrine building was built in 1862.

sen.j: 明治9年に村社、明治14年に郷社に列した。
sen.e: The shrine was listed as sonsha (village shrine) and gosha (village shrine) in 1881.
The shrine was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876 and a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1881.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを追記しました。郷社をa regional shrineとしました。
sen.e: The shrine was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876 and a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1881.

sen.cmt: 大文字に変更しました。

sen.e: The Honen (bumper crop) Dance is dedicated to the shrine.
The Honen (bumper crop) Dance is dedicated to the shrine.
The Honen (bumper crop) Dance is dedicated to the shrine.
